sentences: Gemma Hayes (born 11 August 1977)
section: N/A

sentences: is an Irish musician, singer-songwriter and composer.
section: N/A

sentences: Primarily known as a vocalist and guitarist, she is also proficient with a wide range of instruments, including the piano and the harmonica.
section: N/A

sentences: She is also a member of The Cake Sale and Printer Clips.

== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Hayes grew up in Ballyporeen, Tipperary with her parents and seven other siblings.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She was surrounded by music from an early age heavily influenced by her siblings and her father who was a keyboardist in a local band.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Hayes would later move to County Limerick to attend boarding school.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: By this time, Hayes was proficient at piano and found that the music used to counter the boredom of living in a small village.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She would later move to Dublin City to attend UCD to study sociology, psychology and history.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Hayes soon dropped out of university to concentrate on her music and to gig at music venues across the city.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: This was subsidised by working part-time in a laundrette.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: === EPs and Night on My Side: 2001–2003 ===
section: == Music career == | === EPs and Night on My Side: 2001–2003 ===

sentences: Hayes' music career catapulted upon signing a recording contract with French independent record label, Source Records in 2001.
section: == Music career == | === EPs and Night on My Side: 2001–2003 ===

sentences: Under this label she would release her first EP 4.35am and its follow up Work to a Calm.
section: == Music career == | === EPs and Night on My Side: 2001–2003 ===

sentences: By 2002 her debut album  Night on my Side was released.
section: == Music career == | === EPs and Night on My Side: 2001–2003 ===

sentences: This release received critical acclaim resulting in her winning Best Female Artist at the  Hot Press Awards 2002 and later the album was nominated for Best Album at the 2003 Mercury Prize.
section: == Music career == | === EPs and Night on My Side: 2001–2003 ===

sentences: Hayes toured Europe and the US extensively upon the album's release performing at high profiled festivals such as Ireland's Witnness festival and Montreux Jazz Festival 2002 in Switzerland.
section: == Music career == | === EPs and Night on My Side: 2001–2003 ===

sentences: After touring Night on my Side Hayes took two years out from the music industry;  "All I do know is that I didn't want to listen to music at all.
section: == Music career == | === EPs and Night on My Side: 2001–2003 ===

sentences: I stopped listening to the radio.
section: == Music career == | === EPs and Night on My Side: 2001–2003 ===

sentences: It was like I'd overdosed on music".
section: == Music career == | === EPs and Night on My Side: 2001–2003 ===

sentences: She did however find the time to record a cover of Lay Lady Lay with Magnet.
